results.title: Energy in orbit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Space Science”.
This program uses animated dramatisation to examine the characteristics of potential and kinetic energy, and the ways in which these forces affect a satellite’s orbit.

results.title: Principles of orbit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Space Science”.
How do the laws of inertia and universal gravitation govern the flight of an orbiting satellite? This program investigates the question by demonstrating the behaviour of a satellite, both in circular and elliptical orbit.

results.title: Resources discovered
results.creator_credit: Walter F. Broome and Beechdale Educational Films
results.brief_description: The services which the public library can provide for industry and commerce. How in particular the smaller concern which cannot afford its own special library can through the public library have access to all the information resources of the nation. The way in which the librarian deals with the specific enquiries of different kinds it shown.

results.title: Resistance and the 'High School Walkouts Against Racism'
results.creator_credit: Davina Rimmer, Markus Strazds and Misha Lamb
results.brief_description: The aims of resistance are to bring about a socially equal, democratic and ecologically sustainable socialist world and to organise, educate and mobilise young people to this end. Resistance, a Melbourne based organisation, was involved in organising high school students in protesting against One Nation and the racism this political party espoused and supported. This student movement was called “High School Walkouts Against Racism” and spread nationally with students participating in protest rallies outside the Queensland Parliament against Pauline Hanson and her One Nation Party. This short documentary presents personal views and commentary by two Resistance members, Andy and Liz along with actual footage of some of the protest rallies against racism. Soundtrack: Propagandhi and M.Y.C.

results.title: Reservoir dogs
results.creator_credit: Quentin Tarantino, Lawrence Bender and Dog Eat Dog Productions
results.brief_description: This exciting and controversial independent feature cemented Tarantino’s reputation as an important filmmaker. A brilliant ensemble cast, including Harvey Keital, Steve Buscemi, Tim Roth and Michael Masden, play a gang of armed robbers involved in a heist that goes comically wrong. Featuring a tight and witty script, this audaciously fast-moving film is influenced by the jubilant cinema of the French New Wave. It is also influenced by a gleefully indulgent love of American pop culture. On its release “Reservoir Dogs” was criticised for its violence, in particular, an unsettling torture scene in which Masden takes sadistic pleasure in murdering a cop. It is the mixing of sadism with a comically amoral detachment that marks the film’s break with the Hollywood tradition of the gangster epic and the film noir. There is no sentimental resolution to “Reservoir Dogs”, no clear-cut good guys and bad guys. An astonishingly assured first feature, that is rivetting, disturbing, funny and sometimes suprisingly homoerotic.

results.title: Reservoir
results.creator_credit: Allan Martel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A straightforward informative film, this documentary describes the assembly of a pre-fabricated reservoir in Golden, British Columbia, by a handful of people using ordinary tools. Because of its low cost and easy assembly, this new type of reservoir spells hope for countries where water and money are in low supply.

results.title: Repairing Furniture
results.brief_description: Learn how to choose between white, yellow and hot hide glue, how to dissemble a piece safely and clean surfaces for glueing, how to clamp problem pieces, how to reglue or replace damaged veneer and how to mend broken parts and match missing mouldings.

results.title: Reptiles: a first film
results.creator_credit: George J. Holland, BFA Educational Media and Norman Bean Films
results.brief_description: Introduces basic information about the characteristics of reptiles: body temperature, skin types and habitats. Shows various reptiles in their natural environment including alligators, turtles, snakes and chameleons. Provides a recapitulation of the information presented. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Remembering Marilyn
results.creator_credit: Andrew Solt, Harry Arends, Susan F Walker, Asta Productions and Scotti-Vinnedge Productions
results.brief_description: Lee Remick hosts this tribute to screen goddess Marilyn Monroe, charting her rise to fame from her early years as struggling brunette photographer’s model to her later incarnation as a successful actress and blonde bombshell. This documentary examines the continuing appeal of Monroe and the private hell hidden behind the radiant public facade, and features rare footage of her teenage years, an early television commercial for Royal Triton Fuel, her appearance on the Jack Benny Show, her visit to Korea to perform for the American troops, her controversial rendition of Happy Birthday for President Kennedy, and clips from some of her most famous film roles. Also includes interviews with Gloria Steinem, Robert Wagner, Robert Mitchum, Susan Strasberg, and Monroe herself.
